page.title: 19 Traffic and Transport
page.content: Several independent bus companies operate services through the area although their depots are outside the D-Block. Thornes Motor Services, from nearby Bubwith, serve the scattered houses and farms near the A163 with their Bubwith to Selby route. Thornes, Gorwood Coaches and Philips Coach Company provide school bus services to Barlby High School picking up the few pupils who live in the D-Block. Most of these buses are single deckers, including some vintage vehicles. There is no Sunday bus service. An hour long midweek traffic census along the A 163 recorded a total of 108 vehicles (72 cars, 16 lorries, 10 vans,3 motor bikes, 1 tractor and 1 coach. The most popular van was the Ford Transit and the most recorded car was the Ford Escort.
